channel.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
channel.description:
[CENTER] Dannnneh's Dev Thread [/CENTER]
[CENTER] The Base of the Project is PI, I know i know , Why? Because with the right amount of Skilled Dev's , That base can be re-written and made More stable then ever seen before.
Application format =============== First and Last Name:
Date of Birth:
Time Zone:
Past experience in working with Private Servers:
Past experience with RuneScape Private Servers:
Which Languages other than Java do you know:
Examples of your work:
Can you Develop Server-sided content and features:
Can you Develop Client-sided content as well:
Other than Private Server Development, please list your capabilities:
How do you wish to be compensated:
How can we contact you:
And it's as simple as that.
Payment
You decide how you wish to receive your payments. I only pay weekly every friday , 11AM GMT
Current developers:
[COLOR=Lime]Website Dev & Owner:[/COLOR]
[IMG]http://empathy-06.net46.net/img/title2/icon_crown_gold.gif[/img][URL=http://www.rune-server.org/members/dannnneh/]Dannnneh[/URL]
[COLOR=Lime]Server Dev:[/COLOR] [IMG]http://empathy-06.net46.net/img/title2/icon_crown_gold.gif[/img][URL=http://www.rune-server.org/members/Moe/]Moe[/URL]
[COLOR=Lime]Client Dev:[/COLOR]
1 Needed[/CENTER]

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]

item.description:

“Developement Teams”

k thanks big loads

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Lin:

What sort of client-related work do you need? I don’t know much about adding custom models/animations/etc, but I’ve done things like take an existing client that loaded all of the custom stuff and make it load and dispose it on-demand, using a significantly less amount of memory. I’ve also made a map editor, made an interface editor, refactored a 317, 443, and 474 client, and done a bunch of other tweaks.

I recommend this person. They speak the truth and know what they’re doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

What sort of client-related work do you need? I don’t know much about adding custom models/animations/etc, but I’ve done things like take an existing client that loaded all of the custom stuff and make it load and dispose it on-demand, using a significantly less amount of memory. I’ve also made a map editor, made an interface editor, refactored a 317, 443, and 474 client, and done a bunch of other tweaks.

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“RuneShift1, post:6, topic:468532”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=585501.msg4159413#msg4159413 date=1352929059]

If they don’t show what we would call a minimum stand amount of work , Then there pay wouldn’t be what we agreed upon and would loose out on some cash.

You should be careful about how you do this. Saying to a Developer “Your work isn’t up to par, you aren’t getting paid as much as you thought” is never a good idea.
[/quote]

I am not saying this will happen , but it will if all you done during that week was move a shop.

;)[/quote]

Moving a Shop isn’t programming, or work at all. If your Developer you hire starts talking about adding Items to a Shop, or moving N.P.C. You might as well go ahead and fire him and look for another Developer.

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @RuneShift1 RuneShift1
item.description:
@RuneShift1 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:5, topic:468532”][quote author=RuneShift1 link=topic=585501.msg4159406#msg4159406 date=1352928846]
If they don’t show what we would call a minimum stand amount of work , Then there pay wouldn’t be what we agreed upon and would loose out on some cash.
[/quote]

You should be careful about how you do this. Saying to a Developer “Your work isn’t up to par, you aren’t getting paid as much as you thought” is never a good idea.[/quote]

I am not saying this will happen , but it will if all you done during that week was move a shop.

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

RuneShift1:

If they don’t show what we would call a minimum stand amount of work , Then there pay wouldn’t be what we agreed upon and would loose out on some cash.

You should be careful about how you do this. Saying to a Developer “Your work isn’t up to par, you aren’t getting paid as much as you thought” is never a good idea.

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @RuneShift1 RuneShift1
item.description:
@RuneShift1 wrote:

Well i would ask for them to show proof of there Development , If they don’t show what we would call a minimum stand amount of work , Then there pay wouldn’t be what we agreed upon and would loose out on some cash.

We only need 2 Developers for the fact people will work harder as the pay is higher.

Read full topic

item.title: Dev's Needed [CLIENT SIDED LEFT]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

I recommend you do something similar to this for a Payment System.

They create something, show you proof, and release it to you. After a certain limit, you must pay them before they do anything else. This will work as long as you both have good intentions. You should also pay based on their work done, and not a set or agreed upon amount.

Read full topic

why do you think people will hate on you if you are using PI? many successfull servers and most of the servers now are PI.
